other_tests.findings: At a dose of 75 ng/kg, no follicular development occurred. At 100 ng/kg, a single dominant follicle was recruited, and an endogenous LH surge was elicited. At a dose of 250 ng/kg, gonadotropin and sex steroid dynamics reproduced those of normal ovulatory women, and the proband conceived.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial doses of 75 ng/kg showed no response, mid-cycle responses improved at 100 ng/kg, and normal dynamics were achieved at 250 ng/kg.

other_tests.procedure_name: Frequent blood sampling for LH and FAS
other_tests.findings: Baseline LH and FAS levels were low with mean values of 2.0 60.1 mIU/mL for LH and 122.2 61.8 ng/L for FAS. Five LH pulses and four FAS pulses of low amplitude were identified.
The patient conceived after treatment but suffered recurrent pregnancy loss. An embryo/trophoblast toxic factor was identified.
